FuncDef:
The load-balance gtp teid command enables all Eth-Trunk interfaces on the device to perform load balancing for GTP packets based on the TEID field.
The undo load-balance gtp teid command disables all Eth-Trunk interfaces on the device from performing load balancing for GTP packets based on the TEID field. The load-balance gtp teid command enables all Eth-Trunk interfaces on the device to perform load balancing for GTP packets based on the TEID field. The undo load-balance gtp teid command disables all Eth-Trunk interfaces on the device from performing load balancing for GTP packets based on the TEID field. By default, load balancing for GTP packets based on the TEID field is disabled on all Eth-Trunk interfaces of the device. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: For GTP packets, you can run this command in the system view to configure whether the device performs hash calculation on the packets based on the TEID field.
